titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1424) to amend section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, section 2705 of the Public Health Service Act, and section 9812 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to require equity in the provision of mental health and substance-related disorder benefits under group health plans.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-538, by Ms. Castor.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1424 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 192.

action.text: By direction of the Committee on Rules, Ms Castor called up H. Res. 1014 for its immediate consideration.

POINT OF ORDER - The Broun (GA) raised a point of order against the provisions of H.Res. 1014 because it violates the Congressional Budget Act. The Chair announced that the desposition of the point of order would be resolved by the question of consideration of H. Res. 1014. The House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order at the end of which the Chair will put the question of consideration.
On motion to consider the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 192, 1 Present (Roll no. 94).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1014.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 195 (Roll no. 95).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 209 - 198 (Roll no. 96).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/5/2008--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 1424 (Paul Wellstone Mental Health and Addiction Equity Act of 2007).
